website_summaries.verdict: Leisurely campers and outdoor enthusiasts alike will appreciate the versatility of this reliable model.
pros: Doubles as a mountaineering raincoat and portable blanket
Can also be used as a sun shade
cons: A little too big and wide for many customers
A few owners complained of an odor emitted by the material

customer_reviews.title: Best poncho for the money.
customer_reviews.text: This is a far better poncho than most on the market, I have been looking for a while. This is a real nice poncho made of a rip-stop material with a membrane on the inside. It is lightweight and does not stink the way the vinyl, pvc, or eva ones do.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Wennemar

customer_reviews.title: ~9oz with stuff sack and rain proof
customer_reviews.text: nice ponchos. it weighs about 9 oz with the case. large enough to cover a 50 to 60 liter backpack while wearing and I'm about 6ft tall. kept me dry in torrential rain during Mountain hiking.
customer_reviews.author: Scrooge

customer_reviews.title: O'ya!!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for backpacking because it literally swallows my frame and can double as an emergency flag if ever needed; height 5'3, 135lbs.
customer_reviews.author: jane123

customer_reviews.title: Good Rain Poncho
customer_reviews.text: These are a simple rain poncho's for those who need protection from light rain. I wouldn't recommend these ponchos for work applications or heavy rain. We use ours on a recent trip to Alaska and they worked fine for the light rain we experienced during one of our outings. Many of the hikers on the trail were looking at us rather enviously.
customer_reviews.author: William Struse

customer_reviews.title: Nice Phoncho
customer_reviews.text: Nice size poncho and not as flimsy as others i have tried. Will come i. Handy over the summer during the inevitable baseball game rain delays. P.s. The hood does have a cord.
customer_reviews.author: sth99n

customer_reviews.title: Great hiking poncho
customer_reviews.text: I liked the closure around the neck, which really did keep the rain out. It's a little long in back with just a daypack, but I'm a short guy. Overall, I was impressed that the material is not flimsy, and I didn't have any problem with it snagging or tearing. Good value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Cruiser

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good
customer_reviews.text: What I expected. I don't think this is as good a quality compare to the Sea to Summit poncho, but it seems to be serviceable ( and much less expensive). I think this would be a good choice for people under 5'10",if you're taller be prepared for the front hem to hit at the knee.
customer_reviews.author: S T.

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed in length.
customer_reviews.text: I'm 6'1" and the length of the poncho is disappointing. The front doesn't really cover my knees, which will be a problem with runoff. The back is longer to cover a pack, but still doesn't feel long enough. The material is thin but decent quality. It does look like it will have a saturation point though. It is tightly sewn polyester, so it's not like the old panchos that had no saturation point. I feel I will be wet if I have to hike for hours in the rain, like required on the Appalachian trail, which is what I purchased it for.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Mack

customer_reviews.title: Not good on a chilly camping trip
customer_reviews.text: The hood is small and fits tightly. I had to pull it over my scalp. I am 5'11" and have an average sized head, short hair. No way to wear a hat under it. Not good on a chilly camping trip.
customer_reviews.author: Mike C.

customer_reviews.title: High-Quality Rain Poncho
customer_reviews.text: This is a high-quality rain panchayat! It keeps you dry! Also it makes for an effective tarp'
customer_reviews.author: Dorelle

customer_reviews.title: Pretty solid as far as construction and material goes
customer_reviews.text: Pretty solid as far as construction and material goes. There is a big logo that shows up on the bottom right which I hadn't paid attention to in the pictures so watch out, if you're keen on that sort of thing. Fit and coverage is generous. I'm 6' tall and it goes past my knees.
customer_reviews.author: Atam

customer_reviews.title: I already have a really nice rain jacket
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two of these ponchos for a backpacking trip. I already have a really nice rain jacket, but I was more worried about our packs getting soaked. The ponchos worked great. They do well with covering the packs and body. Also, the lip on the hood helped keep rain out of our faces as well. They fold up relatively easily, and fairly light weight. Given the price, they are great buy. If I wanted to save space/weight in my pack and splurge, I'd try to find a poncho with smaller packaging/lighter weight. However, these served my needs perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: KD

customer_reviews.title: Durable and useful
customer_reviews.text: I live in an area that when it rains, it rains. My mailbox is about a quarter mile and I don't like to use an umbrella. This rain poncho covers me entirely and I am still able to move around like normal. The color is a nice color green. The only drawback is that the smell at first is a bit strong. Also, it is hard to fold back up the poncho and put it back in the bag it comes in but still compact enough that you can put it in a small compact place. I would purchase this again but I probably won't have to due to the durability of the product.
customer_reviews.author: Brent Cox

customer_reviews.title: Good Pancho...but...
customer_reviews.text: It's not rocket science...it's a rain pancho and it works. However, it is virtually impossible to stuff back into the bag once you have extracted it. I don't know why companies do this, and I have seen this with tents as well, where they must have a ten ton hydraulic press to package it, but once extracted, it is not easy at all to get back into the bag. They either needed to include a larger bag, or perhaps make this out of a lighter material. If you want to travel with this, you will have to buy a larger stuff bag.
customer_reviews.author: Roberto

customer_reviews.title: The breathable material is not that breathable but it does do a great job of keeping the rain off of you
customer_reviews.text: Florida at Disney World in August,...... you are going to sweat with this on or off. The breathable material is not that breathable but it does do a great job of keeping the rain off of you. The entire poncho re-folds (rolls) easily into a ripstop bag (provided) and is about the size of a compact umbrella. Compared to what everyone else is wearing at Disney this is the Cadillac of rain ponchos. Unfortunately the neck opening is meant for a child, but it did make it over my big head without ripping. Would I by this again.....yes but I don't think I will have to because it is meant for prolonged wear and multiple uses.
customer_reviews.author: 40 Plus Lifestyle and Leisure

customer_reviews.title: Works well.
customer_reviews.text: These are much better than the cheapos you can buy at Walmart. Trust me, spend a few extra bucks for this one. It packs well and you can actually fold it up and get it back into the sack once you've used it so that it will be ready for the next time. We bought 2 and they worked so well we bought 2 more. We use them for hiking and kayaking and have actually got caught in the rain and been happy we had them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The pouch
customer_reviews.text: Worked as expected. Easy to put on in the chance of sudden rain and putting up was just as simple. The pouch is I guess the right size, I would recommend a wider circumference opening around the top of the pouch where the tension cord is, mainly due to the fact of it tearing if not properly deflated. Just have to remember to squeeze the heck out of the poncho to let all of the air out and then cram it while re-sleeving it. As for the material, it is very durable. Accidentally got too close to some tree branches and it didn’t tear or snag. I’ll definitely buy another once the one I have has been exhausted.
customer_reviews.author: Chip

customer_reviews.title: Quality product.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is heavy for a backpacker, But it's really nice. Worth the extra weight. Ive used it for everything. Besides a raincoat I used it to cover my bag at camp, I used it as a wind sock under my hammock, I used it as a picnic blanket, etc. really convenient and the quality is good. I really appreciate the grommets in the corners it makes it easy to McGuyver things.
customer_reviews.author: janette

customer_reviews.title: Spacious, durable, waterproof
customer_reviews.text: It's a durable, spacious poncho that kind of feels like wearing a tent. I hiked for 7 hours in a steady rain - it kept me and my backpack dry for the first four. It actually lasted longer than some people's gore-tex raincoats! Eventually, it soaked through, as did everyone's rain gear. I recommend buying this poncho over a raincoat to everyone I hike with as it can fit a backpack and is just as waterproof (also, lightweight and easy to pack into it's storage bag!)
customer_reviews.author: Sara M

customer_reviews.title: Works as Promised
customer_reviews.text: What can I say about a rain poncho. I was at a religious convention and had volunteered for parking lot duty. We were told in advance to get a poncho just in case it rains. Well on the last day it poured! And this poncho was great. First the color is quite visible which is great for parking lot or anything where visibility is important. It fits well (I’m a big guy) and it protected me from the rain. I certainly would recommend this item.
customer_reviews.author: Miles T. Hanley

customer_reviews.title: Very high quality.
customer_reviews.text: These are not the cheap ponchos made out of a single layer of plastic. These are heavy, well made and rugged enough to take hunting or any other outdoor activity where you might get caught in a rainstorm. They have snaps down each side, not the cheap hook and loop (velcro). They come in a nice nylon carry bag. I am very pleased and highly recomend these if you are looking for a good poncho.
customer_reviews.author: Johnwp

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Darn Good Poncho
customer_reviews.text: I bought this poncho to hike the Inca Trail in Peru. One day it poured all day and even snowed. I did stay dry--especially compared to those who did not have a poncho, however the poncho was soaked inside and out. It would be great if this poncho had more snaps on the side to make the arms more distinct. I felt like I had wings. Great price and would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Sharris

customer_reviews.title: Good poncho
customer_reviews.text: Poncho is light, ample sized, packs small and definitely waterproof. It kept me and my 65 liter pack dry in heavy rain. My one major complaint is the Velcro side closures. They snagged up my shirt pretty bad during a hike. I would have switched shirts but it was pouring rain and I was in a hurry to get down a mountain before night. I've replaced the Velcro with snaps and now I'm very pleased with the product. Stuff sack is also too small to pack easily but stuff sacks always are.
customer_reviews.author: MontanaRaccoon

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, but the product received did not match the descriptions.
customer_reviews.text: This poncho is labeled yellow on the description and on the package label, but the poncho is definitely orange in color as shown in the photos. The photos show snaps at the neck opening and a zipper for the front pouch, but are actually all velcro closures. The grommets shown at the end of the shoulders are not there on the actual item I received. The material is nice quality comes with a stuff sack not stated in the description.
customer_reviews.author: Work of Art

customer_reviews.title: Great multi-purpose poncho
customer_reviews.text: I like the extra length of this. It's easy to grab and throw on over a backpack during a quick, short rain without having to stop and get out the rain cover for my pack. It's also big enough to double as a waterproof ground cloth if necessary in an emergency.
customer_reviews.author: DaveC

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Poncho
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this in preparation for my son going to camp because I don't like to send his regular rain jacket in case it gets lost. This poncho is strong. I tried poling a hole in it with my finger (to test the strength) and it didn't rip. Ponchos that I've purchased for him in the past have ripped immediately but it even came home from camp in one piece! It should be able to last until next year because it is fairly large which is good because knowing what I went through in camp as a teen with the rain, this provides excellent protection.
customer_reviews.author: Ramona Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Poncho Lean-to for Son
customer_reviews.text: Good Size for my sons. Out main purpose was to use it for shelter. I don't know if I would want to sleep under it. I would have preferred a bigger sized poncho. However, if needed, it would work. Thickness was not too thick and not to thin...but it could've been a little bit thicker for me.
customer_reviews.author: Genome Small Moore

customer_reviews.title: Great poncho
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my tall (4'9") 10yo but it's a bit long as the back is made longer to fit a back-pack under, so on my 10yo the back drags on the ground. It's perfect on me though. It's very durable but light weight! Rolls up easily into the provided pouch. It also has a comfortable hood with a bit of a visor to keep the rain off your face.
customer_reviews.author: Marie-luise Faber

customer_reviews.title: Very large - so makes a great groundcloth for picnics etc
customer_reviews.text: Very light weight but sturdier than the cheap plastic ponchos. Very large - so makes a great groundcloth for picnics etc. I am 5'3" and it comes almost down to my ankles. In light of that I have ditched my rainpants and throw this on with a pair of gaiters when hiking in the rain.
customer_reviews.author: JLC

customer_reviews.title: Small hood
customer_reviews.text: Thought it would be long enough to cover the arms, also the biggest disappointment is that the hood nearly covers the head where in my opinion that's most important, it's very small and because of that not comfortable. Other than that for the price it does the job.
customer_reviews.author: Clementine

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: I live in Florida. If you know anything about Florida, you know that we get a rainy season and a dry season. I used this for riding the bus last year and I could not be happier with my purchase. I used this time and time again and it also would easily cover my backpack as well although the backpack was water-resistant. I'm also 6' 2" tall and it covered me pretty well.
customer_reviews.author: Big Al W.

customer_reviews.title: worked out great at Disney World
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a large poncho for Disney World as thunderstorms were in the forecast and I wanted something that would cover my butt when going on some rides, while being small and lightweight enough that I could keep it in a backpack prior to the storm. Worked like a charm and will bring it on future trips. I also bought another in a different color so my husband and I could tell ours apart.
customer_reviews.author: GinaCalifornia

customer_reviews.title: Great in a pinch, not great in the wind...
customer_reviews.text: The number one reason to buy this poncho is that it can stuffed into the provided sack and thus highly portable. And yep, if the rain is falling more or less straight down, you'll be fine. BUT if it's windy you'll expend a lot of hand motions keepin the poncho where you want it. Recommended for just in case portability., short bursts of rain, and "un-windy" conditions...
customer_reviews.author: RBV

customer_reviews.title: Great for stand hunting
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to keep in my hunting pack while out for Whitetail Deer in Wisconsin. It packs down really small and is light weight. For the price it is great, but keep in mind it's not the most durable or breathable. I have put it on when it's rainy or drizzly and does a good job keeping me dry and out of the wind as well. Perfect for sitting, as I do not foresee it holding up to well while hiking.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Not water repellent
customer_reviews.text: I bought this poncho to wear at football games. Wore it last weekend for the first time and was gravely disappointed. It looked like the rain was being repelled off of the exterior of the poncho, but the inside was actually wet. The rain was somehow seeping through the fabric. It did not keep me dry.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Drizzle Poncho
customer_reviews.text: Oh poncho. Why did you let me down? GRANTED, I took this thing through hurricane Sally for 12 hours straight. BUT 2 hours in the buttons/velcro kept coming undone, and I was completely soaked, and so was my pack. It’s probably going to do okay in a light drizzle, but anything more you should look for something more substantial.
customer_reviews.author: Taiylor Wineland

customer_reviews.title: OVERSIZED AND MULTI PURPOSE
customer_reviews.text: THIS PONCHO IS THE BEST THING I HAVE PURCHASED IN A LONG TIME! WE ARE IN RAINY SEASON HERE IN OKLAHOMA AND WHEN I NEED TO TAKE THE DOG OUT FOR HER WALKS, WHILE IN MY WHEELCHAIR, I NEED SOMETHING THAT I KNOW WILL COVER UP BOTH OPERATOR AS WELL AS MACHINE, AND THIS PONCHO DOES THAT. I BELIEVE THIS PONCHO, IF NECESSARY, CAN ALSO ACT AS GROUND COVER, IN CASE OF EMERGENCY, AS THERE ARE REINFORCED HOLES TO ALLOW YOU TO TIE IT DOWN.
customer_reviews.author: Kath68144

customer_reviews.title: Durable and Orange stood out at Disneyworld
customer_reviews.text: Bought everyone one for Disneyworld and it stood out color wise and the last day only one had a rip in it and we bought tape ahead of time for contingency and it worked great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Heavier and not as compact as hoped
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for a trip to Disney World and I did take them but didn't use them as it never rained. However they did not roll up as compact as I had hoped and were heavier than I had expected so I never even put them in our back pack for the parks. I'm sure I'll still find the occasion to use them eventually but a little disappointed in the size and weight.
customer_reviews.author: Screamin Deacon

customer_reviews.title: Saved us in all day rain!
customer_reviews.text: We did a 3 day/two night backpacking trip last weekend near Ojai, CA. It started raining at 8:45 on Sunday and it did not stop until late that night. My son and I wore our ponchos for 7 hours straight and our core kept perfectly dry. Ot covered or packs well. Nor sure what the life span will be, but fair enough at this price. A pair of rain pants would have helped us as the trail was really overgrown, but the poncho did its part better than expected.
customer_reviews.author: C. Hirsch

customer_reviews.title: Good coverage
customer_reviews.text: These were pretty nice. The boys took them backpacking for 3 soggy days. My son really liked the hood. I like that they closed up with velcro on the bottom. And they went over their backpacks, but they would have liked the back to hang over the backpacks longer, but then that would be awkward for a person without a back pack.
customer_reviews.author: liv

customer_reviews.title: Poncho is great but a little big without a bag on you.
customer_reviews.text: Poncho will work great. the only complaint i have is the bag you put the poncho in is comically small. have to be a expert on origami to make it fit in after taking it out. if the bag was a few inches bigger it would be great. I am not a master folder so it wont fit back in the pouch.
customer_reviews.author: philip

customer_reviews.title: 170lbs fit is a little big but comfortable, folds up and goes back in bag very ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm 5'9",170lbs fit is a little big but comfortable,folds up and goes back in bag very easily.Have not worn in rain yet works great under hose kept me dry i'm very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Ray C

customer_reviews.title: Nice Quality Poncho
customer_reviews.text: I liked this poncho overall. Bought for attending a nfl game in the rain/snow. The zipper is a nice feature for keeping things dry. I would prefer a bag to put the poncho in instead of folding it and fitting it into itself in the zipper section. Its a bit harder to do once its been open. Comes nicely folded. Good quality for the value.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: tore very first time I used it
customer_reviews.text: I am not rough on stuff, but snagged/ripped first time I used it, don't know what as I was standing on a road with nothing near me; shoulder ripped about 10 inches. Could not get back in bag. "Repaired" with duct tape (?) and haven't used it since. Will rely on umbrella from now on.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works well -- great product
customer_reviews.text: Works well -- great product; I can't speak to how durable it is but it's light weight and keeps me dry. Makes a good shelter in a pinch too.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Tadlock

customer_reviews.title: Great for anything but steep terrain
customer_reviews.text: Works well for not that active activities. Used it hiking because it covers a daypack nicely. On flatter terrain it’s no problem, on steep terrain it obstructs your view of where the next step is and where your placing your feet. Climbing up it sometimes gets caught underfoot which can be a disaster.
customer_reviews.author: Baron Von Nobzez

customer_reviews.title: Nice Poncho
customer_reviews.text: Though I haven't yet actually worn it in inclimate weather, on trial fits it will do the job just fine. Price was right- compact for carrying it around, and a relaxing shade of blue.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Salniker

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for heavy rain - covers your entire body - keeps you dry
customer_reviews.text: Ordered for outdoor tours - in the rain. Did not expect much. Half way through the rainy day my 6'5" hubs stole it from me! It's like a soft tent with a hood. Nice feature it folds into a little bag to store and you can take it anywhere. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Susi

customer_reviews.title: A must have for traveling
customer_reviews.text: Used this on my trip to Asia, rained for 6 days straight and kept me dry. Water easily beads off of this. Very durable material, Will buy again
customer_reviews.author: Linda Ly

customer_reviews.title: Good poncho, not so great storing bag
customer_reviews.text: The poncho is big and good. I am 6,3 and fits quite well. However, the bag in which you store it is so tight and small that it makes it quite difficult and time consuming to put the poncho back in. Maybe it just me, but I would have enjoyed if it had a easier to store mechanism
customer_reviews.author: Vlad

customer_reviews.title: Well-made lightweight poncho for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Great poncho for the price. Thin and lightweight, but seems durable. Snaps seem good and no issues with tearing. Hood is well-designed and fits nicely to the head. This is not a heavy-duty item, but perfect as an emergency rain poncho for hikes and other casual uses.
customer_reviews.author: George Coghill

customer_reviews.title: However it strikes the perfect balance between lightweight emergency types
customer_reviews.text: Took off a star bc I revieved the wrong color, and it's not worth the headache of a return. However it strikes the perfect balance between lightweight emergency types, and tough as nails but heavy styles.
customer_reviews.author: KnifemakingPrepper

customer_reviews.title: Packable
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my trip to Ireland next month (March), so I’ll update my review after my trip. I’m super thankful they posted a video on how to get it back in the bag, because there was no way I could have done that on my own.
customer_reviews.author: LaurenRyszka

customer_reviews.title: Keeps you dry and folds up nicely
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this for our trip to Iceland and I am glad we did. It rained for 6 straight days at a temperature of about 45 degrees. It kept me dry every day and help up nice even in the rugged terrain of Iceland. It covers nicely as I am 6'2 and did not end up with the dreaded wet pants legs.
customer_reviews.author: j richards

customer_reviews.title: Durable and useful
customer_reviews.text: Provides a good protection against the rain and endures strong winds (the material is quite heavy). Comes with eyelets to convert this poncho into a tent if necessary. I wish it covered forearms as well but no biggy. A great product for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Dobrin'a

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight.
customer_reviews.text: The color in the photo is a bit off from what it looks like in real life. It is hunter orange. It has grommets at the corners and comes apart to be a tarp. If you want to create a shelter from it you could, easily.
customer_reviews.author: Kwabina

customer_reviews.title: Highly satisfied
customer_reviews.text: Used these instead of umbrellas in Venice during their rainy November. People came up to,us on the street to ask where we got them. Sturdy, easy to pack, covers head shoulders back down to mid hip. Awesome travel item. I think they will last for years unlike the thin clear plastic rain covers.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara M. Carlson

customer_reviews.title: Well made
customer_reviews.text: This poncho is great! I hike a lot with my dog and this poncho gives me awesome coverage and will work if carrying a pack. I only wish it had a front pocket. The fabric is sturdy but light. The hood is worthless for me because I have a lot of hair but it has a draw string on it so if it's cold you can tighten it around your neck.
customer_reviews.author: Rubin

customer_reviews.title: Serves its Purpose
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be well made for the price.The hood fit very well and the drawstring works very nicely.The tote bag could be a little bigger in my opinion.I had some trouble getting the poncho back in the bag at first,but with a little more effort and attention to detail in the way I folded it back up, I was at last successful.Good value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Gary L

customer_reviews.title: Good rain poncho
customer_reviews.text: I use this during my morning walks when it’s raining lightly. It also helps me stay warm when it’s cool outside. It’s a little awkward to get it on and off, but that might just be the nature of the poncho design. I’m very happy with my poncho.
customer_reviews.author: Judith J. McNally

customer_reviews.title: It sucked. It sucked less for me because I was ...
customer_reviews.text: After hiking 25 miles a torrential downpour came for mile 26. The last mile. It sucked. It sucked less for me because I was dry thanks to this bad boy.
customer_reviews.author: Sara Faull

customer_reviews.title: Great protection in the rain
customer_reviews.text: This poncho is my school color. As a teacher on bus lot duty, when it rains, it covers most of me but I have the full range of movement. Its easy to slip on and off and folds up into a small pouch when dried.
customer_reviews.author: Quinn

customer_reviews.title: Perfect - and the orange will make you unmissable!
customer_reviews.text: This poncho was perfect for camping. Light weight and bright. Kept me dry during the downpours and fit over backpack easily.
customer_reviews.author: Karen HD

customer_reviews.title: Great buy the the money.
customer_reviews.text: I will never be caught hiking with out this poncho. If it's raining and hailing, easy to get on and good fit. Covers my back pack and camera bag just fine. The fold away pouch it fits in is another plus. At .6 oz it will fit in any pack without weighing you down.
customer_reviews.author: Janet P.

customer_reviews.title: Great lil rain gear!
customer_reviews.text: Made so well. Great plastic material. Perfect for cruise. Carried in backpack for excursions. Now I use it at home for walking dog. Hangs on hook in garage and can be grabbed easily on rainy walks. Living in Tampa, we need it.
customer_reviews.author: Anita

customer_reviews.title: Keeps you dry!
customer_reviews.text: Great for travel and If you are a travel genius, you will be able to get it back in bag where it belongs after use. After it dried out I was able to get it in the bag. It is a little awkward to get out of bag and put on but it works. Just don't wait till it is pouring down rain.
customer_reviews.author: Lady Blue

customer_reviews.title: Good quality plastic though that seems really durable
customer_reviews.text: Too big/wide. Ended up not using it because of that. Good quality plastic though that seems really durable. There are ringed holes at the sides. Don't know what those are for but mine didn't come with string to loop through those so again I don't know what those are there for.
customer_reviews.author: K Kollinz

customer_reviews.title: Worked great in the rain, very light weight, easy to pack
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 of these for my wife and I to have in case we are stuck out in a down pour. We brought them with on a camping trip and had a good rain in the morning so I threw mine on and made coffee in the rain, kept me nice and dry. A little on the thin side but in a pinch would probably make a decent emergency shelter. The velcro strips seem cheap and I would have preferred snaps but the material is thin enough that it wouldn't be hard to sew on a new strip if needed.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Turnipseed

customer_reviews.title: Great product, exactly what I was looking for!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent coverage and very durable. So much better than even the heavy-weight PVC ponchos that cost nearly as much. If you fold and roll it properly, it easily fits back in the provided stuff sack. The only downside is that it's a bit on the heavy side. If you're into ultralight backpacking, look elsewhere. But if you're car camping or just out for a hike, you need one of these.
customer_reviews.author: Chad Kealey

customer_reviews.title: Great Poncho
customer_reviews.text: I got it just in time for more rain, and it is heavy enough to make it one very excellent buy.
customer_reviews.author: Joel E

customer_reviews.title: My brother didn't like it
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for my brother. We went hiking and it started to rain so he put it on. He said he didn't like using it. Im sure there are those that would like it. Brother didn't care for it much.
customer_reviews.author: Joanne Galvin

customer_reviews.title: Works better than expensive "waterproof" jackets!
customer_reviews.text: Just walked the West Highland Way with a group of 12, and it rained A LOT. My friend and I stayed much drier using these ponchos than our friends did with their very expensive "waterproof" jackets! Tip: roll up a cord of some kind that can tie around your midsection on the outside of the poncho to keep it from flapping around too much in the wind.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great looks great material to keep you dry with out sticking to you...
customer_reviews.text: Haven't used yet. But I tried on looks great and totally will keep us dry. Took on vacation but didn't need . Nice thick material better then those other kinds that are so thin the stick to you when there wet. They even come in a little travel pouch with draw strings
customer_reviews.author: Dyna

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Poncho
customer_reviews.text: Excellent poncho! Keeps the rain out, folds up small. Can also be used as a tarp to great effect :)
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Don't Be Fooled by the Price!!
customer_reviews.text: I was a little skeptical about what the quality was going to be because of the price, but the poncho arrived today and what a nice surprise!! It looks VERY well made, it is fabric, not some flimsy plastic that will tear immediately nor is it a heavier "rubber" material that will crack or be too heavy to actually wear once it gets wet. Very Pleased!
customer_reviews.author: Catherine

customer_reviews.title: Good poncho for light rain; the pocket leaks in heavy rain!
customer_reviews.text: I really liked this poncho when I first wore it in a light rain—it isn’t hot and is roomy enough to carry a bag comfortably underneath. However, the second time I wore it, it was raining hard and the seams on the front pocket leaked. I had thought the pocket was a great idea, but now I wish I’d bought the one without the pocket! I may try lining the inside with duct tape or something; otherwise it really only works for a light rain.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Johnston

customer_reviews.title: I struggle to get in an out of this and definitely could get off and on easily while at the baseball game wearing a hat
customer_reviews.text: From the top of the head to the neck opening was so tight, I could barely move. I struggle to get in an out of this and definitely could get off and on easily while at the baseball game wearing a hat. Disappointing. The vinyl was sturdy. Had the typical short poncho arms, not full coverage or fitted in this area.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Covers everything amazingly except your face!
customer_reviews.text: Kept me and my bag dry. I am an art professor and I’m often carrying artwork with me. In Florida it RAINS. This covered me and everything! Works way better than an umbrella. That said, the hood feels small and will not shield your face.
customer_reviews.author: Trisha L. Toms

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my daughter who went on a 3 week trip to Bolivia. She loves it. Lightweight easy to pack, and came in very handy during the trip.
customer_reviews.author: Ponscella L. Cousins

customer_reviews.title: Durable
customer_reviews.text: I use this poncho at work. I am a sheetmetal worker. Most jackets and all other ponchos get destroyed when exposed to sharp metal while in the field. This poncho has gone above and beyond my expectations
customer_reviews.author: Bryan, and Steph

customer_reviews.title: Great poncho for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good little poncho for the money, considering a carharts goes for $60 or more. It goes down to above my ankles and fits pretty good. I ordered a large. It came with a little bag and instructions too.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy E.

customer_reviews.title: Great buy, worked well and good price!
customer_reviews.text: I had to take a poncho with me on a photographic trip and this one fit the bill. Worked perfectly and standing out in pouring rain at night in Costa Rica kept me dry. Will be taking with me to Alaska later this year!
customer_reviews.author: Leigh LofgrenTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Great large poncho!
customer_reviews.text: We bought these for a trip to Scotland and they are well made (for the cost) and seem to be waterproof. However, we luckily didn't encounter enough rail to pull these out during our visit to the Highlands. At least we have them for future needs.
customer_reviews.author: ATLshopper

customer_reviews.title: Nice Product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son. He doesn't like holding an umbrella. This rain poncho works well for him.
customer_reviews.author: Grace

customer_reviews.title: Met expectations
customer_reviews.text: It was just what I was looking for. Easy to wear and not bulky.
customer_reviews.author: Sojourner

customer_reviews.title: Awesome poncho!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this poncho for backpacking because I like the way it's designed to cover the backpack while still being long enough to keep me dry. Haven't had a chance to test it out for that purpose, but judging by its performance in the downpour today, I'm sure it will be great! It's very lightweight, the adjustable hood & neck closure are fantastic, and it kept me and my ballot dry today when I wore it to go VOTE!
customer_reviews.author: Noelle - Philadelphia

customer_reviews.title: Good for working outside
customer_reviews.text: This poncho kept me dry in a downpour. I walk a lot and work outside, so it's really nice to have. It folds up into a small bag, so it's easy to transport. It's not stylish at all, so I only wear it when I'm working.
customer_reviews.author: Alex White

customer_reviews.title: it makes a better roof than a floor
customer_reviews.text: This poncho is lightweight. As such, it makes a better roof than a floor. I carry it outside my pack should rain showers descend upon me. I hesitate to use it as a ground cloth, because it is so thin. It work to keep my torso and head dry. Arms, not so much. Not a problem this time of year. Pros: Lightweight, folds up fairly compactly, waterproof. Cons: Too light for anything sharp on the ground, limited coverage for extremities. I would buy it again for summer use.
customer_reviews.author: Ian

customer_reviews.title: Great poncho for a big and tall
customer_reviews.text: My husband is 6'4" 3xl and this is roomy for him. Nice thick plastic. It held up well in a sleet storm. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: N. Morrissey

customer_reviews.title: Nice material
customer_reviews.text: This rolls up real nice. It is thick enough that it feels way better than those disposable trash bag looking ones, but isn’t too heavy feeling on.
customer_reviews.author: Ohiomommy79

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic rain cover and added warmth
customer_reviews.text: Took this along during a trip. Was suppose to be good weather but it turned out to be rainy and quite chilly. The poncho repelled the rain and provided extra warmth against the unexpected chill. Am very rough on garments. This held up quite well. Very pleased with this purchase
customer_reviews.author: oldbeane

customer_reviews.title: Protection from rain and wind, waterproof hat with big flap is needed
customer_reviews.text: Right coverage and worked as a wind shelter too. Went on 4 day Inca Trail recently. Loved the protection from wind as well as rain. I’m 5’3 and this felt like it was too large on me but with hands and hiking poles inside worked perfect. It was a matter of learning how to use it with pouring rain. A waterproof hat with large flap should help keep rain drops away from face.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good value - not so durable
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this poncho for backpacking. To keep me and the backpack dry. It worked well initially, then I noticed the lining was starting to peel under the hood and around the edges of the poncho. The hood eventually leaked. The durability is not that great but for the price, I’ll give it 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: so so
customer_reviews.text: for the price it's ok. be nice if it had sleeves. could use more buttons or velcro. hard to get over your backpack by your self.
customer_reviews.author: John Engelbert

customer_reviews.title: lightweight, effective, cheap
customer_reviews.text: The headline says it all. You won't be winning any fashion awards in this, but you WILL be dry. It is genuinely waterproof, not water-resistant. Easy to fold up, store, and put on. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. ZHI

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic poncho
customer_reviews.text: I carried this poncho in my handbag anticipating rain and boy did it come in handy! I love the fact that it has both grommets and buttons. The quality is great, not too light and not too heavy. It provided full coverage and kept me dry.
customer_reviews.author: Jaybee

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size! Anda the material of the product its ...
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size ! Anda the material of the product its looks like super High quality
customer_reviews.author: jose mendoza

customer_reviews.title: Great poncho!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband to wear when it rains at our son’s baseball and football games. I am impressed. Very sturdy and goes past his knees (he’s 5’10”) but isn’t too heavy. Comes in a nice pouch that you can easily get the poncho back into. Would definitely buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany Stone

customer_reviews.title: 3 yrs in still working
customer_reviews.text: Use for day hiking and backpacking. 3 yrs in still water proof and still working. One of the best backpacking purchases I made.
customer_reviews.author: C. Davenport

product_meta.title: Terra Hiker Waterproof Rain Poncho, Hiking Rain Jacket, Reusable Rain Coat for Outdoor Activities
feature_bullets: Stay Dry and Comfortable: This rain poncho is PU3000MM waterproof, is remarkably water resistant, and dries quickly. The hood also has an adjustable drawstring to help protect your face.
3-IN-1 RAINCOAT: Multi-use poncho is specially designed for outdoor activities; can be used as a mountaineering raincoat, or a mat for hiking, picnics, fishing and more
STRENGTHENED WATERPROOF FUNCTION: Made from 210T high density polyester fabric that's PU3000MM waterproof; seam-sealed and fully waterproof

EASY AND CONVENIENT: Roomy back is able to accommodate a large capacity backpack of up to 60 L; cuffs with Velcro on both sides ensure maximum comfort; cap margin with elastic rope for effective protection
PORTABLE AND COMPACT: Can be folded into a compact size of 8.66 x 3 x 2 in (22 x 7.5 x 5 cm) and weighs only 0.68 lb (310 g) for great portability

3- LAYER THICKENING: Thickened eyelets create enhanced durability; eyelets on the hem are for fastening to tent stakes; conveniently pop up the poncho to use it as a mat or sunshade (stakes not included)
